intro: Conyza serrana, commonly known as the hairy weed or serrated conyza, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Africa and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and serrated leaf margins. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in arid and semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit and produces copious amounts of wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its adaptability, it is often considered an invasive species in some areas.
